    Get a prior distribution from priors

    get_prior_distribution.Rd

    Add to the model a `n_draws x n_param` matrix of possible parameters.

    Usage

    get_prior_distribution(model, n_draws = 4000)

    Arguments

    model

    A causal_model. A model object generated by make_model.

    n_draws

    A scalar. Number of draws.

    Value

    A `data.frame` with dimension `n_param`x `n_draws` of possible lambda draws

    See also

    Other prior_distribution: make_prior_distribution(), set_prior_distribution()

    Examples

    make_model('X -> Y') %>% set_prior_distribution(n_draws = 5) %>% get_prior_distribution()
#>            X.0        X.1      Y.00       Y.10      Y.01       Y.11
#> [1,] 0.9248429 0.07515707 0.1255273 0.29792724 0.4069488 0.16959662
#> [2,] 0.6429786 0.35702137 0.0512957 0.21602521 0.2976917 0.43498737
#> [3,] 0.6923722 0.30762780 0.3272465 0.14067830 0.1437907 0.38828445
#> [4,] 0.4381408 0.56185915 0.4002786 0.04588988 0.1746839 0.37914763
#> [5,] 0.2281559 0.77184408 0.4042927 0.02760660 0.5502818 0.01781892
make_model('X -> Y') %>% get_prior_distribution(3)
#> The model does not have an attached prior distribution; generated on the fly
#>            X.0        X.1      Y.00      Y.10       Y.01      Y.11
#> [1,] 0.9623201 0.03767993 0.3153011 0.1454395 0.08705922 0.4522003
#> [2,] 0.7426517 0.25734825 0.4291829 0.2236045 0.17287206 0.1743405
#> [3,] 0.4247568 0.57524321 0.3083280 0.3088788 0.10834477 0.2744484
